posts.name: david
posts.cooked:
We recently got a power cable from andymark which had a reversed ground and power on our Anderson.

By accident we plugged this in and led to our breaker popping. Has anyone had issues with this?

image 3024×4032 2.97 MB

image 3024×4032 2.97 MB

image 3024×4032 2.97 MB

posts.name: Jon Stratis
posts.cooked: I seem to recall a similar issue popping up a few years ago… perhaps with the ones in the KoP? I’ve always double checked out cables since!

posts.name: Domtech
posts.cooked:
Reverse voltage doesn’t trip the breaker, the high current drawn from all the the other components that are not meant to be powered that way does.

Make sure you carefully check over all your components to make sure they survived.

posts.name: Brian Wagg
david
posts.cooked: This happened right before we left for competition We’ll check when we arrive. Will be swapping the breaker.

posts.name: NathanNFM
posts.cooked: Thanks for the report! I just checked the shelf and the rest are fine. These are assembled in house, in small batches, so this was likely a one off. Sorry about that! You can pretty easily repair it yourself by following the guide at the bottom of the product page .

posts.name: Kim
posts.cooked: I really really hope you didn’t plug this into the robot.  Reverse-polarity connecting is a really solid way to kill motor controllers, especially Spark Maxes.

posts.name: Peter Johnson
posts.cooked: As stated, it was plugged into the robot, unfortunately.  It sounds like it tripped off quickly though, so I’m hoping for them that their electronics may have mostly survived.  It’s highly likely that something was killed though.

posts.name: david
posts.cooked: Update: Everything lived! We swapped the breaker for good measure but we ran some game pieces and everything seemed to be good.
